parameters.name: Input pdb file 1
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Ligand file
parameters.description: Upload a ligand file in .mol2 format. Open the .pdb file in pymol_v2 and select the ligand or cofactor; Export the selection as .mol2 file and upload it here.

parameters.name: View settings
parameters.description: Upload a set_view file. Open the .pdb file in pymol_v2 and change the view of your structure to the view you would like to have. Afterwards type <get_view> into the pymol command-line and paste the output into a text file (set_view.txt for instance) and upload it here.

parameters.name: Activity plotting
parameters.description: Upload activity data file in !tab seperated! format. Should look like this: pH    %   stdev -> Copy the data from Excel directly into a .txt file and upload it here.

parameters.name: pH Range: min max steps
parameters.description: Example: 5 7 0.5

parameters.name: Disable activity plotting
parameters.description: Allows to disable activity plotting, however pH range is still choosen from activity file.

parameters.name: Update Axis
parameters.description: Activates re-rendering of the axis and/or activity data. Will skip ABPS, pdb2pqr and pymol calculations.

parameters.name: Update Axis and Picture
parameters.description: Activates re-render of surface pictures and axis and/or activity data. Will skip ABPS and pdb2pqr calculations.

parameters.name: Digits for pH values
parameters.description: Choose how many digits the pH values submitted via pH-range or activity file have. However, does not affect the calculations, only important for the axis visualization. Example: pH-range 5 7 0.25 -> choose 2 digits, otherwise the final axis will round up 5.25 to 5.3 for instance.

parameters.name: Picturesize in pixel
parameters.description: Size of each individual protein picture generated by pymol. Value 500 corresponds to 500x500 px (a quadratic picture). 500 should be a good default for a sufficient resolution of the final picture, however setting it to higher values would allow to generate picture for posters or so. I set a limit of 2000 maximum, because changing this value to higher increases calclulation time.

parameters.name: Background color
parameters.description: Choose background color. Default is no color -> transparent background.

parameters.name: #Activity: Data format
parameters.description: Select if activity data are provided with or without error data in third column.

parameters.name: #Activity: Lollipop circle radius
parameters.description: Adjust the circle size for the activity lollipop bar.

parameters.name: #Activity: Lollipop circle color
parameters.description: Color for the lollipop bar circle

parameters.name: #Activity: Lollipop circle stroke color
parameters.description: Color for the lollipop bar cirlce stroke

parameters.name: #Activity: Lollipop bar color
parameters.description: Color for the lollipop bar

parameters.name: #Activity: Lollipop errorbar color
parameters.description: Color for the lollipop errorbar

parameters.name: #Activity: Tick mark linewidth
parameters.description: If activity data are plotted, a gridline is drawn and here you can set the mark linewidth.

parameters.name: #Activity: Tick mark placement
parameters.description: Select if tick marks should inside or outside; default is - which means outside.

parameters.name: #Activity: Fontsize Grid Label
parameters.description: If activity data are plotted, a gridline is drawn and here you can set the mark linewidth.

parameters.name: # Pymol: Surface Mode
parameters.description: Surface mode from PyMol; which atoms to include in calculation of surface; 0 -> ATOMS, 1 -> Atoms, HetAtoms, Hydrogens, 2 -> Heavy Atoms, 3 -> Visible Atoms, 4 -> Visible and Heavy Atoms.

parameters.name: Enable SASA Surface
parameters.description: Activates surface representation based on solvent accessible surface area.

parameters.name: Disable Surface Above Mode
parameters.description: Deactivates surface representation with pymol surface_ramp_above_mode. Smoothes the surface color.

parameters.name: #Pymol: Ligand style
parameters.description: Representation of ligand Atoms.

parameters.name: Disable Ramp Legend
parameters.description: Deactivates representation of the ramp legend in the lower left corner.

parameters.name: #Pymol: Ramp Level
parameters.description: Level of the color ramp for positive and negative charge representation.

parameters.name: #Pymol: Ramp colors: Neg, Neutral, Pos
parameters.description: Default: red, white, blue

parameters.name: #Style: Label Font
parameters.description: Select font for axis label.

parameters.name: #Style: Label Fontsize
parameters.description: Font size for the axis labels (pH values, Protein names).

parameters.name: #Style: Label Font Weight
parameters.description: Select font weight for axis label.

parameters.name: #Style: Label Font Stretch
parameters.description: Select font stretch for axis label.

parameters.name: #Style: Label Font Style
parameters.description: Select font style for axis label.

parameters.name: #Style: pH Values - Alignment
parameters.description: Select alignment of the pH values.

parameters.name: #Style: Protein Names - Alignment
parameters.description: Select alignment of the protein names.

parameters.name: Disable Axis Lines
parameters.description: Deactivates representation of axis lines. Makes only sense if activity plotting is disabled.

parameters.name: #Style: Axis Lines Thickness
parameters.description: Thickness of the axis lines.

parameters.name: #Style: Axis Lines Color
parameters.description: Color for the axis lines

parameters.name: #Style: Axis Lines Offset
parameters.description: Offset for axislines (x-Axis:left and right; y-Axis:top and bottom); Important to label the axis with % and pH.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 2
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 3
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 4
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 5
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 6
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 7
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 8
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 9
parameters.description: Select pdb file.

parameters.name: Optional: Input pdb file 10
parameters.description: Select pdb file.
